eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.enhancement

Interface Enhancement

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EnhancementFirearm, EnhancementRocketLauncher

    public interface Enhancement

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void afterRoundFired(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack weaponStack, net.minecraft.world.World world, net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
      Called after the weapon fires a round and the entity is spawned.
      boolean canApplyTo(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack)
      Whether this enhancement is valid for the given itemstack.
      java.lang.String getID()
      The enhancement's unique identifier.

      The location of the new model for the weapon.

      The unlocalized name, exactly as it is in the lang file, for the weapon that will be created by installing this upgrade.

      default void onWeaponUpdate(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack weaponStack, net.minecraft.world.World world, net.minecraft.entity.Entity entity, int itemSlot, boolean isWeaponCurrentItem)
      Called in Item#onUpdate for enhancement-containing items.

    • Method Detail

      • canApplyTo

        boolean canApplyTo(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack)
        Whether this enhancement is valid for the given itemstack.
        Parameters:
        stack - The ItemStack being upgraded.
        Returns:
        Whether the enhancement can be used on the ItemStack.

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        The enhancement's unique identifier. This should be something humanly readable and easily identified in code. This is used when determining which upgrade is installed in the tool.
        Returns:
        The String ID.

      • getModel

        net.minecraft.util.ResourceLocation getModel(net.minecraft.item.Item item)
        The location of the new model for the weapon. This is not the same as the enhancement's texture name. The "inventory" is assumed by the firearms' mesher.

        For example: EsteemedInnovation.MOD_ID + ":rocket_launcher_air_strike"; Follow the existing MC way of doing this.

        Parameters:
        item - The weapon item.
        Returns:
        The resource location string for the new weapon created by upgrading it.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName(net.minecraft.item.Item item)
        The unlocalized name, exactly as it is in the lang file, for the weapon that will be created by installing this upgrade.

        For example: item.esteemedinnovation:rocketLauncherAirStrike.

        Parameters:
        item - The weapon item.
        Returns:
        The unlocalized name of the new weapon.

      • onWeaponUpdate

        default void onWeaponUpdate(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack weaponStack,
                            net.minecraft.world.World world,
                            net.minecraft.entity.Entity entity,
                            int itemSlot,
                            boolean isWeaponCurrentItem)
        Called in Item#onUpdate for enhancement-containing items.
        Parameters:
        weaponStack - The ItemStack for the weapon.
        world - The current world
        entity - The current containing entity
        itemSlot - The slot in the entity's inventory that the weapon is contained in.
        isWeaponCurrentItem - Whether the weapon is the current item.

      • getVolume

        default float getVolume(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack weaponStack,
                        net.minecraft.world.World world,
                        net.minecraft.entity.EntityLivingBase user)
        Parameters:
        weaponStack - The ItemStack for the weapon.
        world - The world
        user - The user
        Returns:
        The volume modifier for sounds produced by the weapon. Depending on the item and case, this might be the actual volume, or used in some volume determining math.

      • afterRoundFired

        default void afterRoundFired(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack weaponStack,
                             net.minecraft.world.World world,
                             net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Called after the weapon fires a round and the entity is spawned. This is after the ArrowLooseEvent is sent and after the ItemStack's loaded NBT key is decremented.
        Parameters:
        weaponStack - The ItemStack for the weapon
        world - The world
        player - The player firing the round.
